header.title: The Scroll of Set
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Satanism, Left-Hand Path

central_thesis: The Scroll of Set, Issue #45, documents a pivotal leadership transition within the Temple of Set, installing Magus Ronald Keith Barrett (Anubis) as High Priest and introducing 'Xem' ('Coming Into Being', 'Higher Man') as a new 'Word' representing an advanced evolutionary stage beyond 'Xeper'. The various articles explore the philosophical underpinnings, practical magical applications, and internal organizational dynamics supporting this individual and collective becoming.

structure_content.chapter_title: [1] It is Now the Time for the Coming Into Being of Xem
structure_content.summary: Announces Ronald Keith Barrett (Anubis) as the new High Priest of the Temple of Set and details his personal journey from Presbyterianism to Satanism and Setianism. His recognition as Magus V° on the South Solstice XIII, the creation of the Anubis Pylon, and the introduction of 'Xem' as his Word are highlighted, signifying a new phase for the Temple.

Recognizes Linda S. Thomas as a Magistra Templi IV°, confirmed by Magus Ronald K. Barrett, the High Priest, and the Council of Nine, acknowledging her 'Coming Into Being' through her will toward Xeper.

A philosophical essay emphasizing that 'thrones' (representing individual power and self-sovereignty) are built and maintained by individual will and might, not passively acquired. It warns against 'stasis' and urges Setians to actively grow their 'thrones' through Xeper to attain 'immortal majesty'.

Linda Thomas's personal reflection on overcoming a difficult period, attributing her recovery and growth to the 'Elect' (fellow Setians). She emphasizes individual responsibility, 'fledgling freedom,' and the pursuit of 'Coming Into Being as a god' through continuous Setamorphosis.

Proposes structured telepathy experiments among interested Setians. The experiments would involve transmitting and receiving known, agreed-upon languages (glyphs, numbers, symbols) with the aim of consistent practice and verification, potentially involving a third party for results validation.

Provides an update on the composition of the Council of Nine, including the appointment of Magistra Lilith Sinclair as Chair and Priestess Sandy Sarris and Priest Lynn Norton as Councillors. It specifies the nine-year term of office and the Council's role as the Temple's Board of Directors.

A technical analysis debunking popular interpretations of relativity, specifically regarding atomic clock experiments and meson/electron behavior. The author attributes observed phenomena to environmental factors and the law of conservation of mass/energy, rather than to mystical or unexamined physical principles.

Explores the concept of freedom for the 'Elect,' differentiating it from mere escape. It posits that true freedom involves accepting pain, embracing self-knowledge, and actively becoming a 'living Power of Darkness' through Xeper, existing within a balance of reality without destruction.

structure_content.chapter_title: [9] Magic and the Law of Karma
structure_content.summary: Critiques the traditional 'Law of Karma' as a religious behavior control mechanism. From a Setian perspective, negative consequences of destruction rituals are attributed to the practitioner's own guilt and repressed fears, not cosmic retribution. It advises performing magic without guilt and reveling in the results.

A ritualistic anthem affirming Setian identity as gods who arise from the errors and weaknesses of the 'lowly'. It emphasizes their might, wisdom, and eternal 'Xeper,' proclaiming their rebellion and their connection to Set as an 'everlasting presence in the universe'.
Announces Stephen H. Bushey's recognition as a Priest of Set III°, noting his prior recognition as Adept II° and his relocation from Massachusetts to San Francisco.

structure_content.chapter_title: [12] The Seasons: Their Time of Celebration, Meaning, and Influence
structure_content.summary: Explains the magical significance of solstices and equinoxes for Setian practice. It details appropriate rituals for each season: 'planting seeds' at spring equinox, celebration at summer solstice, introspection at autumn equinox, and destruction rituals at winter solstice, which is also the strongest point of HarWer's control. It also mentions Walpurgisnacht, All Hallow's Eve, and the concept of a personal 'Xeper-day'.

Provides astronomical and historical context for equinoxes and solstices, linking them to traditional pagan holidays (Halloween, Candlemas, Beltane, Lammas) and their influence on the 'solar-tide cycle.' It describes the waxing and waning of 'bright' and 'dark' tides throughout the year.
Lists recent resignations and changes to inactive status within the Temple of Set membership, including Margaret A. Wendall, Michael J. Waters, Alan L. Sturrock, and Patricia S. Turner.

Redefines 'prayer' from a Setian perspective as 'commerce with Set'. This emphasizes an intimate, dual presence and active engagement, distinguishing it from the supplicatory distance associated with traditional religious prayer.

Contrasts Setian philosophy with Stoicism, rejecting the latter's adherence to 'natural law' and conformity. It asserts that Setians embrace the Left-Hand Path, exploring non-matter, non-humanity, and non-nature, siding with the 'dark element' to discover Set and grow beyond natural constraints, choosing 'willfully to be perverse for our own benefit'.

A personal account of applying Setian will, the challenges of gaining respect from non-Setians, and the realization that true Setian magic involves directing energy inward for self-analysis and understanding. The author shares how this process led to Priesthood and deeper insight into personal experiences.

structure_content.chapter_title: [18] Re-Definition of the word 'Solidarity' in these Changing Times
structure_content.summary: Examines the concept of 'solidarity' in the context of recent tumultuous changes within the Temple of Set. It argues that true solidarity, unlike transient external structures, stems from individual introspective work and the redefinition of personal values, essential for the 'Elect' to stand firm.
A humorous list of bizarre and challenging scenarios encountered in magical practice, serving as a lighthearted commentary on potential pitfalls or absurdities in esoteric work.

Analyzes Tarot card #16, The Tower, linking it to the 'Utterance' (Xem) and astrological Capricorn (exaltation of Mars). It interprets The Tower as symbolizing major, often unexpected changes, the descent of life force, spiritual truth, and the introduction of new concepts, particularly relevant to the new Magus and the ongoing evolution of Setianism.
Announces Magister L. Dale Seago as the new Director of 1F (First Foundation), indicating an organizational change within the Temple of Set.

key_concepts.definition: The new 'Word' for the Temple of Set, introduced by Magus Ronald K. Barrett. It is described as the 'Coming Into Being' and 'Higher Man,' representing a continuation and broadening of 'Xeper' and a new phase of Setian evolution.
The fundamental Setian process of 'Becoming,' emphasizing self-creation, self-evolution, and individual actualization. It is an ongoing, active process of growth and transformation.

The true will of the Prince of Darkness, which is embodied and carried by the Magus who best represents this will at a given time. It signifies the spiritual authority and impetus for the 'Æon of Set'.
Individuals chosen by Set, or those who consciously aspire to become so through the Setian path. They are recognized for their unique will and potential for self-deification.

The Setian philosophical and practical orientation that involves exploring non-matter, non-humanity, and non-nature. It represents a rebellion against conventional constraints, natural law, and herd mentality, aimed at individual growth and 'Becoming'.

A redefined concept of 'prayer' within Setianism. It signifies an intimate, direct, and dual presence with Set, emphasizing active engagement and interaction rather than supplicatory distance and subservience.
The process of individual transformation and evolution within the Setian framework, leading towards 'Coming Into Being as a god' and deeper self-realization.
A metaphorical representation of individual power, self-sovereignty, and the responsibility to actively build and maintain one's personal might and stability through conscious will and Xeper.

Rejected by Setians as a traditional religious concept of cosmic retribution for 'evil' acts. Instead, negative consequences from destruction rituals are attributed to the practitioner's own internal guilt, repressed fears, and 'monsters of the id'.

A high-ranking, initiated leader within the Temple of Set, holding the highest degree (V°) and responsible for guiding the Æon of Set and the Temple's philosophical direction. Ronald K. Barrett is recognized as the new Magus V°.

Interpreted in the context of Setianism as symbolizing major, often unexpected, changes. It represents the descent of life force, spiritual truth, the power of 'Utterance' (linked to Xem/Higher Man), and intense personal magnetism, particularly associated with the astrological sign Capricorn and the exaltation of Mars.

practical_system.description: The Temple of Set's practical system, as outlined in this Scroll, is centered on individual self-initiation and conscious self-deification (Xeper/Xem) through the Left-Hand Path. It emphasizes the development of personal will, rigorous introspection, and rejection of external moral frameworks like 'Karma'. Magic is understood as a means to effect personal and environmental change, with success contingent on the practitioner's internal state (e.g., absence of guilt). Seasonal and cosmic timings (solstices, equinoxes) are integral for aligning magical workings. 'Commerce with Set' replaces traditional prayer, emphasizing intimate, active engagement with the Dark Lord. The system encourages structured experiments in mental magic and a constant push beyond perceived natural or human limitations towards a 'Higher Man' state.
tools: Knowledge and application of astrological/seasonal timing (solstices, equinoxes, lunar cycles)
Directed magical energy (inward for self-understanding, outward for change)
Known, agreed-upon languages for telepathy (glyphs, numbers, symbols)
Rejection of guilt and external moral judgment
rituals: Contrived personal rituals (self-devised, often rebellious practices)

relevant_quotes.text: The 'Infernal Mandate' is carried by whoever best represents the true will of the Prince of Darkness at a given point of time. I am convinced that the 'Infernal Mandate' has now passed. Xeper has Uttered, and it is now the time for the Coming Into Being of Xem. The impetus of the Æon of Set is now in the care of another Magus.

To be free is to accept pain, the pain of knowing what is past is no more; it is not to shun the future and to resolve the present. As one experiences Xeper closer to Set, alien feelings and loneliness are necessary ingredients to become a living Power of Darkness.

In order for an evil act to return to someone, there would need to be a god who has a set of rules for what constitutes good and bad behavior. Then this God would hand down justice to anyone breaking the rules.
We Setians see nature itself as restricting the potential of mankind see the Stoic doctrine as the narrow, Right-Hand Path.

The mature Setian is the ultra-realist. If we are mature Setians, we choose willfully to be perverse for our own benefit. We use our ability to take the straight and wide Left-Hand Path, explore non-matter, non-humanity, non-nature. We side with the dark element. Together we discover Set, the primeval balancer; joining with him, we will to rebel for him. We grow, we Become.
Guard your Flame; it is the key that Opens the Way to immortality.

critical_analysis.relevance: The Scroll of Set, Issue #45, is highly relevant as a primary document detailing a significant period of internal development and philosophical expansion within the Temple of Set. It chronicles the transition of the 'Infernal Mandate' and the High Priesthood, marking the introduction of a new 'Word' (Xem) that conceptually builds upon 'Xeper' to guide Setian evolution towards 'Higher Man'. The document serves to consolidate organizational changes, reaffirm core Setian tenets, and offer practical guidance for initiates. It blends introspective, self-developmental themes with more outward-facing magical practices and even includes a scientific critique of pseudo-scientific claims, reinforcing a rational yet esoteric approach unique to Setianism. The articles collectively provide a rich, multi-faceted insight into the contemporary concerns and aspirations of the Temple of Set during this era.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience comprises initiates and members of the Temple of Set. This includes various degrees of practitioners (I° through V°) who are engaged in the philosophical and practical pursuit of Setianism. The document assumes familiarity with Setian terminology, history, and organizational structure. It is intended for those seeking to understand the ongoing evolution of the Temple's philosophy, the specific applications of Setian magic, and the principles guiding individual and collective advancement within the Left-Hand Path.
